type.context: INDUSTRIES AID AND ENCOURAGEMENT ACT under Form of application for a licence. 4. Every application for a licence shall be in the form set out in the Second Schedule, and shall be made to the Commissioner, who shall submit such application to the Minister.

type.title: Bond.
type.context: INDUSTRIES AID AND ENCOURAGEMENT ACT under Bond. 5. type.name: section
type.title: Period of exemption from customs duties and taxes.
type.context: INDUSTRIES AID AND ENCOURAGEMENT ACT under Period of exemption from customs duties and taxes. 6. Every applicant to whom a licence is granted under section 3 shall be entitled to import any of the items to which such licence relates, free of any customs import duties and taxes for such period, not exceeding ten years in the case of a mining undertaking or five years in the case of any other undertaking, as the Minister may direct:  Provided that this section shall not apply to items imported as replacements or renewals of any existing machinery, plant or appliances, or for the purpose of rehabilitation of existing machinery, plant or equipment.

type.name: section
type.title: Restrictions on disposal of articles.
type.context: INDUSTRIES AID AND ENCOURAGEMENT ACT under Restrictions on disposal of articles. 7. No item which has been imported into Guyana under section 6 shall be sold, given away or otherwise disposed of by the licensee without payment of all customs import duties and taxes which would, but for section 6, have been payable, except with the permission of the Commissioner and in the following circumstances:  LAWS OF GUYANA Industries Aid and Encouragement Cap. 95:01 5  L.R.O. 1/2012                        Revocation of licence, (29 of 1967)                 s. 3 [47 of 1956 21 of 1957 29 of 1967]              (a) where the items have been disposed of to some other  person to whom a licence to import such items free of customs import duties and taxes has been granted under section 3; or  (b) after the expiration of five years from the date on which such items have been entered for use in Guyana.
